page.title: 03St. Marys Church
page.content: The{pews}in the nave are quite modern in appearance but they have been there since 1845. The backs of the pews are the original 17th century box pews. There are five{bells}in the bell tower. Two of them were cast in Whitechapel, by Thomas Mears in 1841, but the third and fourth bell are much older. The third bell was cast by R.Wells of Aldbourne, the neighbouring village, which had a very famous bell foundry .It carries the date 1712.The fourth bell has no maker given but has the date 1663.The fifth bell was cast by Henry Bagley in 1742, but we do not know where. Outside in the{churchyard,}there ia a row of lime trees leading from the thatched lych gate to the church steps.These trees are the villages memorial to the men of the village who
